bibl.title: Radiocarbon Dating of a Particular Type of Coptic Woollen Tunics.
bibl.note: Radiocarbon dating of 12 (fragments of) tunics of a particular type from "Katoen Natie" in Antwerp. Several authors date the tunics as late as 11th or 12th centuries. The radiocarbon dating turns out to be of a much earlier date, between c. 450 A.D. and c. 650 A.D.

bibl.title: with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II

bibl.seg: DE MOOR Antoine, Mark VAN STRYDONCK and Chris VERHECKEN-LAMMENS, Radiocarbon Dating of a Particular Type of Coptic Woollen Tunics.

Mat IMMERZEEL and Jacques VAN DER VLIET (Edd.), with the assistance of Maarten KERSTEN and Carolien VAN ZOEST, Coptic Studies on the Treshold of a New Millennium. Proceedings of the Seventh International Congress of Coptic Studies. Leiden, 27 August - 2 September 2000. II = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 133 (Leuven, 2004) pp. 1425-1442, 15 figg.

Radiocarbon dating of 12 (fragments of) tunics of a particular type from "Katoen Natie" in Antwerp. Several authors date the tunics as late as 11th or 12th centuries. The radiocarbon dating turns out to be of a much earlier date, between c. 450 A.D. and c. 650 A.D.
